edu.uidaho.junicon.grammars.junicon

Class JuniconPreprocessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uidaho.junicon.grammars.common.AbstractPreprocessor
      • edu.uidaho.junicon.grammars.junicon.JuniconPreprocessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPreprocessor

    public class JuniconPreprocessor
extends AbstractPreprocessor
implements IPreprocessor
    A line-by-line preprocessor for the Junicon parser. The preprocessor changes the program in the following ways.
    • Handles directives such as $include, $define, and $undef. Note that directives can end with ";", and in interactive mode must do so. Provides $defineFixed directive that prevents recursive substitution.
    • Performs conditional compilation for $ifdef $else $endif, and $ifndef.
    • Substitutes definitions in identifier tokens.
    • Inserts semicolons between lines beginning new statements, if a line ends with an ender token and the next line begins with a beginner token.
    • Inserts braces in procedure, class, method, and initially constructs if not already present.
    • Fixes quotes by translating backslash escape sequences not found in Java, including hex, octal, and control escapes.
    • Fixes integer numbers by truncating leading 0's so as to avoid misinterpretation of them by Java as octals.
    A number of other changes to maintain compatibility with Java are performed in the javacc parser and the transformer instead of this preprocessor. These include:
    • Quote continuations of the form "... _[newline] [wspace] ..." are already handled in the javacc parser.
    • Ebcdic translation of sequences $( $) $< $> to { } { } are also handled in the javacc parser.
    • Character sets (cset) for single quote literals are handled by the transforms.
    • Radix literals are handled by the transforms.
    • Arbitrary precision for arithmetic operations are handled by transforming into java.math.BigInteger and BigDecimal operations.

      • ListLiteral

      • setRelaxedUniconSyntax

        public void setRelaxedUniconSyntax(boolean isRelaxed)
        Set if keep strict unicon syntax or allow new relaxed syntax with braces instead of semicolons in procedure, method, class, and initially statements. Strict syntax should only be used if using the preprocessor as a standalone feed into legacy Unicon compilers. Strict syntax is incompatible with the Junicon interpreter, since the statement detector will incorrectly recognize inserted semicolons as end of statement. Default is relaxed.

      • getRelaxedUniconSyntax

        public boolean getRelaxedUniconSyntax()

      • setDoSemicolonInsertion

        public void setDoSemicolonInsertion(boolean doSemicolonInsertion)
        Set if do semicolon insertion, under both relaxed and strict syntax. Default is on.

      • setSubstituteOperators

        public void setSubstituteOperators(boolean onoff)
        Set if $define will substitute for any token, not just identifiers. Default is on.

      • substituteFromDefinitions

        public LinkedList<Token> substituteFromDefinitions(LinkedList<Token> tokens,
                                                   Map<String,edu.uidaho.junicon.grammars.junicon.JuniconPreprocessor.Substitution> defns)
        Substitute definitions in identifier tokens. Substitution is recursive but does not reapply definition on itself. Substitution is not applied inside quotes or preprocessor directives.

      • fixSemicolons

        public LinkedList<Token> fixSemicolons(LinkedList<Token> tokens,
                                       boolean shouldAppendSemicolon)
        Insert braces instead of semicolons after closing parameter parenthesis for procedure, class, method, and initially constructs. Otherwise insert semicolons at end of previous line if shouldAppendSemicolon, i.e., last line ended with an Ender token and this line begins with a Beginner token that signals a new statement. This brings the syntax into a form compatible with MetaParser statement detection. The rules for inserting braces, and not inserting semicolons, are as follows: 
                procedure id() ;|[^{] ==> procedure id() {
        [^abstract] method id() ;|[^{] ==> method id() {
        class id[supers]() [;]|[^{] ==> class id[supers]() {
            subsumes: class id[supers]() ; end ==> class id[supers]() { }
        initially [()] ;|[^{] ==> initially () {
        end(after initially) ==> } }
        end ==> }
        Be aware that the user may not be inserting above semicolons required by the grammar, instead assuming that this preprocessor does.
        Parameters:
        tokens - List of tokens to scan
        shouldAppendSemicolon - If should append semicolon after previous line and before this line

      • fixQuotes

        public LinkedList<Token> fixQuotes(LinkedList<Token> tokens)
        Fix \escapes in quotes to be compatible with Java. Underscore quote continuations were already fixed in the quote fuser before this (quoteOnlyMode StatementDetector).

      • fixNumbers

        public LinkedList<Token> fixNumbers(LinkedList<Token> tokens)
        Fix octal numbers to be compatible with Java by translating 0n* to n* in integer and floating point numbers.
